summary: This document appears to be a jail observation log, likely from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), tracking an inmate on suicide watch or psychological observation. The log records meal consumption, liquid intake, shower activity, and detailed behavioral observations over a period of time. The inmate's name is heavily redacted but the context strongly suggests it is Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the jail observation log, tracked for meals, liquids, showers, and detailed behavioral notes while on suicide watch or psychological observation.

events.title: Jail Observation Log Entry
events.description: Detailed log of inmate Jeffrey Epstein's activities, behavior, meals, and monitoring while on suicide watch or psychological observation.

keyFacts: The document is a detailed jail observation log for an inmate on suicide watch or psychological observation, with the inmate's name heavily redacted but contextually identifiable as Jeffrey Epstein.
The log meticulously tracks the inmate's meal consumption (breakfast, lunch, dinner), liquid intake, shower activity, and behavioral observations.
Observations include notes on the inmate's sleeping patterns, movements in the cell, and interactions with staff, indicating close monitoring.
The document is dated July 6, 2019, placing it during Epstein's incarceration prior to his death in August 2019.
The log specifies strict item allowances for the inmate, including only a suicide smock and blanket unless otherwise marked, highlighting the restrictive conditions of suicide watch.
